title: In a row of 40 children, P is 13th from the left end and Q is 9th from the right end. How many children are there between P and R, if R is 4th to the left of Q? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us arbitrarily number the children from 1 to 40 starting on the right. P is 13th from the right therefore is assigned the number 13. Q is 9th from the right. We will assign the number 32 to Q. R is 4th to the left of Q. We will assign the number 28 to R. Calculating the number of children between P and R is equivalent to calculating how many numbers are between the number 13 and the number 28. We may naievilly say it is 15 since 28–13=15. That would be wrong. That total would include P or R. Therefore we must subtract 1 from our naive answer to get 14. Thus there are 14 children between P and R.

14 P is 13th from left…means 27 children are on the right side of P. Q is 9th from right ….means 31 children are on the left side of Q. R is 4th to the left of Q …means..13th from the last right end child and 28th from the Left end child Between P&R there are 28–13 -1=14
